About Me

Learn more about my background, expertise, and professional journey.

Professional Summary

I started my career in the US Army, starting as a Systems Engineer, promoted to Engineering Manager, and then later selected to help form the Cyber Protection Brigade as a Security Engineer. Those first 10 years of my career taught me a lot about leadership, project management, and how to build a team that succeeds in a resource constrained environment.

Since then, I’ve had the opportunity to dive deep into software and security engineering challenges at tech companies like Facebook and Amazon, and apply the things I learned there at smaller companies that need both technical skills and thoughtful leaders.

Why do I get out of bed?

“Bosses” and “Managers” are a dime a dozen. The world needs more Leaders. My favorite memory about every role I’ve ever had is the moment that things “clicked” for the team… They have someone to support them. They are on a team where our shared belief is “if you take care of the people, the people will take care of the business”. The team we built together is the best team they’ve ever been on, and they will strive to take our values with them wherever they work.

Professional Experience

On a resume we share “what we’re proud we accomplished”… but what I love talking about the most is “the things I learned there”.

Head of Security

rabbit inc. • 2024 - Present I learn something new almost daily here… so my “favorites” change regularly. For now:

  • Mobile Device Security (Hardware and AndroidOS), from the manufacturer’s lens
  • AI Agent Development and the security challenges that it brings
  • Business Development and Sales Engineering

Director of Security Engineering

NielsenIQ • 2022 - 2024 This was a new one for me; until this point, the engineering teams I supported were trying to balance speed and availability with little concern for cost. A NIQ, customers cared more about accuracy and cost than anything else. This led to my discovery of design patterns I’ve never seen (or had to secure) before.

  • I added a new carrot to my feedbag here, “if you do it securely, it will be cheaper”
  • I learned about the Scaled Agile Framework here, and absolutely love it.

Director of Security Engineering

Zip Co • 2022 - 2022 There is a stereotype in the engineering community that “everything cool is built on GCP or AWS”. Zip was the first place I worked where most of the infrastructure was on Azure. And the design was… impressive. This was my first (non-military) experience discussing security strategy and results with a board of directors on a regular basis.

  • We adopted a modified Eisenhauer Matrix, “How fast will it kill the company” x “How long will it take to do”. I love this mental model.

Cloud Security Tech Lead
